dc:description:
The *HMGA2* (high mobility AT-hook 2) gene located on chromosome 12 at 12q14.3 encodes a encodes a member of the non-histone chromosomal high mobility group (HMG) protein family – architectural factors and essential components of the enhanceosome. Loss of Hmga2 was first reported to be associated with growth restriction in mice (Zhou et al 1995, PMID: 7651535) and microdeletions of 12q had also implicated *HMGA2* as a cause of Silver Russell Syndrome (SRS) (OMIM:618908) (Spengler et al., 2010, PMID: 19762329). SRS diagnosis is based on the Netchine-Harbison clinical scoring system (NH-CSS) from Azzi et al. 2015 (PMID: 25951829) Suggestive findings include intrauterine growth restriction, feeding difficulties in early childhood, and postnatal growth failure. Dysmorphic features include triangular face with frontal bossing or prominent forehead, micrognathia, and relative macrocephaly at birth. Skeletal features include fifth finger clinodactyly and/or small hands. Other findings include high pitched voice, developmental delay, and genitourinary abnormalities (Saal et al., 2025, PMID: 20301499). 

9 unique variants from 9 individuals in 5 publications including splice  (Gorbenko del Blanco et al., 2011, PMID: ​21803798; de Crescenzo et al., 2015, PMID: 25809938), frameshift (Yamoto et a.,l 2024, PMID: 38840187; Maharaj et al., 2024, PMID: 38516887), nonsense and missense variants (PMID: 38516887) have been reported and are included in this curation . Variants in *HMGA2* have been observed to segregate with SRS in families (PMID: 25809938) and also occur de novo (Zhang et al., 2025, PMID: 40393763). More genetic evidence is available in the literature, but the maximum score for genetic evidence (12 pts.) has been reached.The mechanism of pathogenicity appears to be loss of function. This gene-disease relationship is also supported by experimental evidence including functional alteration of patient cells (PMID: ​21803798) and expression in relevant tissues (Zhou et al., 1995, PMID: 7651535). Several homozygous and heterozygous knockout and knock-in animal models recapitulate growth, cranial, and genitourinary dysmorphology (PMID: 7651535; Lee et al., 2022, PMID: 34878116; PMID: 38516887). 

In summary, there is definitive evidence supporting the relationship between *HMGA2* and AD SRS. This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both the research and clinical diagnostic settings, and has been upheld over time. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Syndromic Disorders GCEP on the meeting date June 20th, 2025 (SOP Version 11). The ClinGen preferred term for this condition is *HMGA2*-related Silver-Russell-like syndrome.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zhang 2025 SRS Family

member.rdfs:label: Zhang 2025 SRS Proband1
member.phenotypeFreeText:
Growth restriction:  birth weight of 2.35 kg (-2.2 s ) and a birth length of 46 cm (-2.0 s ).
Feeding difficulties: poor appetite and was picky about food
Craniofacial: triangular face, broad forehead, small mandible, low-set ears, Skeletal: slightly valgus elbows, delayed bone age
Parents normal height

evidence.rdfs:label: Gorbenko del Blanco 2011 SRS Family

member.rdfs:label: Gorbenko del Blanco 2011 SRS Proband II-2
member.phenotypeFreeText:
Normal birth weight and length but age 3 height SDS was -4.8.
Craniofacial: frontal bossing, doll’s face
Reproductive: micropenis.
Skeletal: Delayed bone age - At the age of 3.5 years, his bone age was 1.3 years. Other:  high-pitched voice, Abnormal pituitary magnetic resonance imaging(MRI) with an undetectable anterior pituitary and anectopic posterior pituitary. Growth hormone treatmen began at 3yo.  His final adult height is 1.87m (+0.6 SDS compared with the normal population).

evidence.rdfs:label: De Crescenzo 2015 SRS Family

member.rdfs:label: De Crescenzo 2015 SRS proband
member.phenotypeFreeText:
Female Italian proband w/  IUGR, relative macrocephaly at birth, weight SDS= −2.5, height= SDS= −1.3 and head circumference SDS= −1. GR at 2 and 4yo

Craniofacial: characteristic face with triangular form and broad and prominent forehead, thin upper lip, micrognathia, epicanthus, hypertelorism
Digital: brachy-clinodactyly V of the hands, syndactyly II–III of the feet
Feeding difficulties: during early childhood, gastro-esophageal reflux, 
Reproductive:  clitoral hypertrophy 
Other: muscular hypotrophia, cafe au lait spot
member.previousTestingDescription: Microarray ruled out 11p15 (epi)mutations or maternal uniparental disomy of chromosome 7 (matUPD7).

evidence.phenotypeFreeText:
Female proband w/  IUGR, relative macrocephaly at birth, weight SDS= −2.5, height= SDS= −1.3 and head circumference SDS= −1. GR at 2 and 4yo

Craniofacial: characteristic face with triangular form and broad and prominent forehead, thin upper lip, micrognathia, epicanthus, hypertelorism
Digital: brachy-clinodactyly V of the hands, syndactyly II–III of the feet
Feeding difficulties: during early childhood, gastro-esophageal reflux, 
Reproductive:  clitoral hypertrophy 
Other: muscular hypotrophia, cafe au lait spot
Mother also w/ typical features of SRS (low stature −3.87 SDS, triangular face with prominent forehead, brachydactyly V, and post-natal growth retardation and feeding difficulties during early childhood.
Proband’s Mat gf and mat aunt also affected, but not genotyped.

evidence.dc:description: Not unexpected for NMD-prone variant to have no protein detected
lack of protein detected in a HEK293T expression system
Patient fibroblasts had weak detection of nuclear protein vs neonatal control fibroblasts
HEK293T expression system revealed reduced protein expression for p.Arg49Glyfs*117

Total RNA derived from the patient and control fibroblasts.
RT-PCR experiments from fibroblast cDNA, did not show any changes in major HMGA2 transcript expression (HMGA2a) but expression of other transcripts were reduced  (HMGA2d and HMGA2e, Fig. 2C)
: In vitro studies in HEK-293T cells showed that this variant resulted in normal expression amount and distribution, but resulted in significantly decreased DNA binding affinity

See Figure 3. Minigene splicing assay. (a) Structure of the minigene into the RHCglo plasmid and sequences of the HMGA2 gene analyzed in this study. The minigene exons are shown as orange boxes. The two alternative splice variants are also shown: (a) derived from the removal of intron I and II and the junction of exon 1, 2 and 3; (b) derived from the removal of intron I, exon 2 and intron II, and the junction of exon 1 with exon 3. The primers used for RT–PCR are indicated by arrows. The wild-type (wt) and mutant (ΔA, ΔB and ΔC) sequences were inserted between the SalI and BamHI sites. The wt insert includes the last 45 nucleotides of the HMGA2 intron 4, the ΔA insert includes the same sequence of wt without the last 7 nucleotides, the ΔB insert includes the same sequence of ΔA plus the first 3 nucleotides of exon 5 and the ΔC insert includes the same sequence of ΔA plus the first 15 nucleotides of exon 5. The acceptor dinucleotides AG of intron IV are in green, while the putative alternative acceptor dinucleotides of exon 5 are in blue and underlined. (b) Gel electrophoresis of RT–PCR products obtained from NIH3T3 cells transfected with the minigene constructs. The 111 bp fragment corresponding to the splice variant (a); The 79 bp band corresponds to the alternative splice variant (b). Fragments with lower mobility correspond to incorrectly spliced transcripts. Cells transfected with the original RHCglo plasmid and untransfected cells (NT) were analyzed as controls. Note that the correctly spliced transcript is generated by the wt but not by the mutant constructs.
Reduced weight since mouse model MOI is AR while human MOI is AD. However, partial weight is awarded due to heterozygous mice weighing 80% of wt
Recapitulates growth restriction in both males and females
evidence.rdfs:label: Lee 2022 CRISPR-Cas9 Hmga2tamu-ko mice
